name: (C) ESTAR HP FS (NG Furnace)
_description: ENERGY STAR air source heat pump (w/ cold climates specs as applicable) fully replacing original NG furna ceequipment

notes: Split system ducted (see Tables 2 (warm climates) and 3 (cold climates) in EPA source)
conversion from original standard: COP = SEER / 3.412, COP = HSPF / 3.412 (see EIA source)
split system conversion factors SEER2/SEER = 0.95, HSPF2/HSPF = 0.85 (see RESNET source)

source_data.title: ENERGY STAR Program Requirements Product Specification for Central Air Conditioner and Heat Pump Equipment Version 6.1
source_data.author: U.S. Environmental Protection Agency

source_data.title: Draft PDS:01, MINHERS Addendum 71, SEER2/HSPF2 Conversions
source_data.author: RESNET

source_data.title: Residential Demand Module of the National Energy Modeling System: Model Documentation 2014
source_data.author: U.S. Energy Information Administration

notes: Uses residential system costs and normalizes by typical capacity of residential systems (36 kBtu/h)
Retail (new) and total installed (existing) cost for ENERGY STAR ASHPs in 2023
For existing buildings, added costs of $6300 are the average of the cost range for circuit breaker panel upgrade and home service upgrade costs in the NV5 report
a new circuit cost of 700 $2022 using the upper bound (assuming a high amperage 240V circuit is required for the HVAC system) from the NV5 report
and additional tank removal costs of 800 2014$ (975 2022$) are applied for distillate and propane based on the 2015 EIA report, updating the cost from April 2014 to April 2022.

source_data.title: Updated Buildings Sector Appliance and Equipment Costs and Efficiencies
source_data.author: U.S. Energy Information Administration

source_data.title: Service Upgrades for Electrification Retrofits Study Final Report
source_data.author: NV5 and Redwood Energy

product_lifetime_source.notes: Average of the ENERGY STAR range

source_data.title: Updated Buildings Sector Appliance and Equipment Costs and Efficiencies
source_data.author: U.S. Energy Information Administration

notes: Heating multiple of 8% was determined by dividing square feet in which main heating equipment is gas furnace (14491406 sf) by square feet in which main heating equipment is gas furnace or packaged unit (176461522 sf)

cooling multiple of 63% was determined by dividing square feet in which cooling equipment is residential split system or individual AC unit  AND heating equipment is natural gas (23128802 sf) by square feet with same cooling constraint and heating across all fossil fuel types (36556957 sf).
